abstract: Groupon’s astounding success has encouraged a wave of copycat start-ups but how many can survive?
snippet: Groupon’s astounding success has encouraged a wave of copycat start-ups but how many can survive?
lead_paragraph: Created by Jason Casperson and Adam Jacox, PetSimply is one of a seemingly endless supply of Groupon clones that have been introduced of late (many since Groupon turned down a $6-billion buyout offer from Google). As Jessica Bruder reports in an article we’ve just published, there are, for example, Groupon knock-offs that sell daily deal coupons to gay people (Daily Pride), to the gluten-intolerant (Gluten-Free Deals) and to small-business owners (GroupPrice).

headline.main: How Many Groupon Clones Does the World Need?
